rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: الٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَقُرْءَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the signs of the Book and a manifest Quran.
rows.transliteration: alif lām rā ۚ tilka āyātul kitābi waqur-ānin mubīn

rows.arabic: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Much will the faithless wish that they had been Muslims.
rows.transliteration: rubamā yawaddul ladhīna kafarū law kānū muslimīn

rows.arabic: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا۟ وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ وَيُلْهِهِمُ ٱلْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Leave them to eat and enjoy and to be diverted by longings. Soon they will know.
rows.transliteration: dharhum ya-kulū wayatamatta`ū wayulhihimul-amal ۖ fasawfa ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
rows.translation: We did not destroy any town but that it had a known term.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ahlaknā min qaryatin illā walahā kitābun ma`lūm

rows.arabic: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
rows.translation: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it.
rows.transliteration: mā tasbiqu min ummatin ajalahā wa mā yasta-khirūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِى نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ
rows.translation: They said, ‘O you, to whom the Reminder has been sent down, you are indeed crazy.
rows.transliteration: waqālū yā-ayyuhal ladhī nuzzila `alayhidh dhikru innaka lamajnūn

rows.arabic: لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Why do you not bring us the angels should you be truthful?!’
rows.transliteration: law mā ta-tīnā bil malā-ikati in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِذًا مُّنظَرِينَ
rows.translation: We do not send down the angels except with due reason, and then they will not be granted any respite.
rows.transliteration: mā nunazzilul malā-ikata illā bil ḥaqqi wa mā kānū idhan munẓarīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا ٱلذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed We have sent down the Reminder, and indeed We will preserve it.
rows.transliteration: innā naḥnu nazzalnadh dhikra wa innā lahu laḥāfiẓūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى شِيَعِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly We sent [apostles] before you to former communities,
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā min qablika fī shiya`il-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: and there did not come to them any apostle but that they used to deride him.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ya-tīhim min rasūlin illā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُۥ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: That is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:
rows.transliteration: kadhālika naslukuhu fī qulūbil mujrimīn

rows.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: they do not believe in it, and the precedent of the ancients has already passed.
rows.transliteration: lā yu-minūna bih ۖ waqad khalat sunnatul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّوا۟ فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
rows.translation: Were We to open for them a gate of the sky, so that they could go on ascending through it,
rows.transliteration: walaw fataḥnā `alayhim bāban minas samā-i faẓallū fīhi ya`rujūn

rows.arabic: لَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَـٰرُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ
rows.translation: they would surely say, ‘Indeed a spell has been cast on our eyes; indeed, we are a bewitched lot.’
rows.transliteration: laqālū innamā sukkirat abṣārunā bal naḥnu qawmun mas-ḥūrūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّـٰهَا لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly We have appointed houses in the sky and adorned them for the onlookers,
rows.transliteration: walaqad ja`alnā fis samā-i burūjan wazayyannāhā linnāẓirīn

rows.arabic: وَحَفِظْنَـٰهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَـٰنٍ رَّجِيمٍ
rows.translation: and We have guarded them from every outcast Satan,
rows.transliteration: waḥafiẓnāhā min kulli shayṭānin rajīm

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: except someone who may eavesdrop, whereat there pursues him a manifest flame.
rows.transliteration: illā manis-taraqas sam`a fa-atba`ahu shihābun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ
rows.translation: And We spread out the earth, and cast in it firm mountains, and We grew in it every kind of balanced thing,
rows.transliteration: wal-arḍa madadnāhā wa-alqaynā fīhā rawāsiya wa-anbatnā fīhā min kulli shay-in mawzūn

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَـٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
rows.translation: and made in it [various] means of livelihood for you and for those whom you do not provide for.
rows.transliteration: waja`alnā lakum fīhā ma`āyisha wa man lastum lahu birāziqīn

rows.arabic: وَإِن مِّن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
rows.translation: There is not a thing but that its sources are with Us, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.
rows.transliteration: wa in min shay-in illā `indanā khazā-inuhu wa mā nunazziluhu illā biqadarin ma`lūm

rows.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَا ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَسْقَيْنَـٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُمْ لَهُۥ بِخَـٰزِنِينَ
rows.translation: And We send the fertilizing winds and send down water from the sky providing it for you to drink and you are not maintainers of its resources.
rows.transliteration: wa-arsalnar riyāḥa lawāqiḥa fa-anzalnā minas samā-i mā-an fa-asqaynākumūhu wa mā antum lahu bikhāzinīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed it is We who give life and bring death and We are the inheritors.
rows.transliteration: wa innā lanaḥnu nuḥyī wanumītu wanaḥnul wārithūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَـْٔخِرِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly We know the predecessors among you and certainly We know the successors,
rows.transliteration: walaqad `alimnal mustaqdimīna minkum walaqad `alimnal musta-khirīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: and indeed it is your Lord who will resurrect them. Indeed, He is all-wise, all-knowing.
rows.transliteration: wa inna rabbaka huwa yaḥshuruhum ۚ innahu ḥakīmun `alīm

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
rows.translation: Certainly We created man out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud,
rows.transliteration: walaqad khalaqnal-insāna min ṣalṣālin min ḥama-in masnūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْجَآنَّ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
rows.translation: and We created the jinn earlier, out of a piercing fire.
rows.transliteration: wal jānna khalaqnāhu min qablu min nāris samūm

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى خَـٰلِقٌۢ بَشَرًا مِّن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
rows.translation: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am going to create a human out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla rabbuka lil-malā-ikati innī khāliqun basharan min ṣalṣālin min ḥama-in masnūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُۥ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِى فَقَعُوا۟ لَهُۥ سَـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him.’
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā sawwaytuhu wanafakhtu fīhi min rūḥī faqa`ū lahu sājidīn

rows.arabic: فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,
rows.transliteration: fasajadal malā-ikatu kulluhum ajma`ūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: but not Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated.
rows.transliteration: illā iblīsa abā an yakūna ma`as sājidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓإِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘O Iblis! What kept you from being among those who have prostrated?’
rows.transliteration: qāla yā-iblīsu mā laka allā takūna ma`as sājidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
rows.translation: Said he, ‘I will not prostrate before a human whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud.’
rows.transliteration: qāla lam akun li-asjuda libasharin khalaqtahu min ṣalṣālin min ḥama-in masnūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
rows.translation: He said, ‘Begone hence, for you are indeed an outcast,
rows.transliteration: qāla fakhruj minhā fa-innaka rajīm

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ ٱللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
rows.translation: and indeed the curse shall lie on you until the Day of Retribution.’
rows.transliteration: wa inna `alaykalla`nata ilā yawmid dīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi fa-anẓirnī ilā yawmi yub`athūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
rows.translation: Said He, ‘You are indeed among the reprieved
rows.transliteration: qāla fa-innaka minal munẓarīn

rows.arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْوَقْتِ ٱلْمَعْلُومِ
rows.translation: until the day of the known time.’
rows.transliteration: ilā yawmil waqtil ma`lūm

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَغْوَيْتَنِى لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘My Lord! As You have consigned me to perversity, I will surely glamorize [evil] for them on the earth, and I will surely pervert them, all
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi bimā aghwaytanī la-uzayyinanna lahum fil-arḍi wala-ughwiyannahum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
rows.translation: except Your dedicated servants among them.’
rows.transliteration: illā `ibādaka minhumul mukhlaṣīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ عَلَىَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ
rows.translation: He said, ‘This is the path [leading] straight to Me.
rows.transliteration: qāla hādhā ṣirāṭun `alayya mustaqīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِى لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنٌ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْغَاوِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed, as for My servants you do not have any authority over them, except the perverse who follow you,
rows.transliteration: inna `ibādī laysa laka `alayhim sulṭānun illā manit-taba`aka minal ghāwyn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: and indeed hell is the tryst of them all.
rows.transliteration: wa inna jahannama lamaw`iduhum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَٰبٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ
rows.translation: It has seven gates, and to each gate belongs a separate portion of them.’
rows.transliteration: lahā sab`atu abwābin likulli bābin minhum juz-un maqsūm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
rows.translation: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and springs.
rows.transliteration: innal muttaqīna fī jannātin wa`uyūn

rows.arabic: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍ ءَامِنِينَ
rows.translation: ‘‘Enter it in peace and safety!’’
rows.transliteration: ud-khulūhā bisalāmin āminīn

rows.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَٰنًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَـٰبِلِينَ
rows.translation: We will remove whatever rancour there is in their breasts; [intimate like] brothers, [they will be reclining] on couches, facing one another.
rows.transliteration: wanaza`nā mā fī ṣudūrihim min ghillin ikhwānan `alā sururin mutaqābilīn

rows.arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
rows.translation: Therein neither weariness shall touch them, nor will they [ever] be expelled from it.
rows.transliteration: lā yamassuhum fīhā naṣabun wa mā hum minhā bimukhrajīn

rows.arabic: نَبِّئْ عِبَادِىٓ أَنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
rows.translation: Inform my servants that I am indeed the All-forgiving, the All-merciful,
rows.transliteration: nabbi-`ibādī annī anal ghafūrur raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِى هُوَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ٱلْأَلِيمُ
rows.translation: and that My punishment is a painful punishment.
rows.transliteration: wa-anna `adhābī huwal `adhābul-alīm

rows.arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
rows.translation: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
rows.transliteration: wanabbi-hum `an ḍayfi ibrāhīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
rows.translation: when they entered into his presence and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘We are indeed afraid of you.’
rows.transliteration: idh dakhalū `alayhi faqālū salāman qāla innā minkum wajilūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed we give you the good news of a wise son.’
rows.transliteration: qālū lā tawjal innā nubashhiruka bighulāmin `alīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِى عَلَىٰٓ أَن مَّسَّنِىَ ٱلْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘Do you give me good news though old age has befallen me? What is the good news that you bring me?’
rows.transliteration: qāla abashhartumūnī `alā an massaniyal kibaru fabima tubashhirūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَشَّرْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْقَـٰنِطِينَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘We bring you good news in truth; so do not be despondent.’
rows.transliteration: qālū bashharnāka bil ḥaqqi falā takun minal qāniṭīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘Who despairs of his Lord’s mercy except the astray?!’
rows.transliteration: qāla wa man yaqnaṭu min raḥmati rabbihi illaḍ ḍāllūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’
rows.transliteration: qāla famā khaṭbukum ayyuhal mursalūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,
rows.transliteration: qālū innā ursilnā ilā qawmin mujrimīn

rows.arabic: إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: [who shall perish] except the family of Lot. We will indeed deliver all of them,
rows.transliteration: illā āla lūṭin innā lamunajjūhum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَآ ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: except his wife, [who], We have ordained, will indeed be among those who remain behind.’
rows.transliteration: illam-ra-atahu qaddarnā innahā laminal ghābirīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
rows.translation: So when the messengers came to Lot’s family,
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-a āla lūṭinil-mursalūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
rows.translation: he said, ‘You are indeed strangers [to me].’
rows.transliteration: qāla innakum qawmun munkarūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Indeed, we bring you what they used to doubt.
rows.transliteration: qālū bal ji-nāka bimā kānū fīhi yamtarūn

rows.arabic: وَأَتَيْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
rows.translation: We bring you the truth, and indeed, we speak truly.
rows.transliteration: wa-ataynāka bil ḥaqqi wa innā laṣādiqūn

rows.arabic: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱتَّبِعْ أَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَٱمْضُوا۟ حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
rows.translation: Take your family in a watch of the night; and follow in their rear, and none of you should turn round, and proceed as you are bidden.’
rows.transliteration: fa-asri bi-ahlika biqiṭ`in minal layli wattabi` adbārahum walā yaltafit minkum aḥadun wamḍū ḥaythu tu-marūn

rows.arabic: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ
rows.translation: We apprised him of the matter that these will be rooted out by dawn.
rows.transliteration: waqaḍaynā ilayhi dhālikal-amra anna dābira hā-ulā-i maqṭū`un muṣbiḥīn

rows.arabic: وَجَآءَ أَهْلُ ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
rows.translation: The people of the city came, rejoicing.
rows.transliteration: wajā-a ahlul madīnati yastabshirūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيْفِى فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
rows.translation: He said, ‘These are indeed my guests. Do not bring dishonour on me.
rows.transliteration: qāla inna hā-ulā-i ḍayfī falā tafḍaḥūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ
rows.translation: Be wary of Allah and do not humiliate me.’
rows.transliteration: wattaqullāha walā tukhzūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘Did we not forbid you from [defending ] strangers?’
rows.transliteration: qālū awalam nanhaka `anil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِىٓ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘These are my daughters, [marry them] if you should do anything.’
rows.transliteration: qāla hā-ulā-i banātī in kuntum fā`ilīn

rows.arabic: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِى سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
rows.translation: By your life, they were bewildered in their drunkenness.
rows.transliteration: la`amruka innahum lafī sakratihim ya`mahūn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ
rows.translation: So the Cry seized them at sunrise,
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhat-humuṣ ṣayḥatu mushriqīn

rows.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
rows.translation: and We made its topmost part its nethermost, and rained on them stones of shale.
rows.transliteration: faja`alnā `āliyahā sāfilahā wa-amṭarnā `alayhim ḥijāratan min sijjīl

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ
rows.translation: There are indeed signs in that for the percipient.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyātin lil-mutawassimīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُّقِيمٍ
rows.translation: Indeed it is on a standing road,
rows.transliteration: wa innahā labisabīlin muqīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: and there is indeed a sign in that for the faithful.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyatan lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ لَظَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed the inhabitants of Aykah were [also] wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: wa in kāna aṣ-ḥābul-aykati laẓālimīn

rows.arabic: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: So We took vengeance on them, and indeed the two of them are on an open highway.
rows.transliteration: fantaqamnā minhum wa innahumā labi-imāmin mubīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْحِجْرِ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly the inhabitants of Hijr denied the apostles.
rows.transliteration: walaqad kadhhaba aṣ-ḥābul ḥijril mursalīn

rows.arabic: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا فَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
rows.translation: We had given them Our signs but they disregarded them.
rows.transliteration: wa-ātaynāhum āyātinā fakānū `anhā mu`riḍīn

rows.arabic: وَكَانُوا۟ يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا ءَامِنِينَ
rows.translation: They used to hew out dwellings from mountains feeling secure.
rows.transliteration: wakānū yanḥitūna minal jibāli buyūtan āminīn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ
rows.translation: So the Cry seized them at dawn,
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhat-humuṣ ṣayḥatu muṣbiḥīn

rows.arabic: فَمَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
rows.translation: and what they used to earn did not avail them.
rows.transliteration: famā aghnā `anhum mā kānū yaksibūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَـَٔاتِيَةٌ ۖ فَٱصْفَحِ ٱلصَّفْحَ ٱلْجَمِيلَ
rows.translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them except with consummate wisdom, and indeed the Hour is bound to come. So forbear with a graceful forbearance.
rows.transliteration: wa mā khalaqnas samāwāti wal-arḍa wa mā baynahumā illā bil ḥaqq ۗ wa innas sā`ata la-ātiyah ۖ faṣfaḥiṣ ṣafḥal jamīl

rows.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ ٱلْخَلَّـٰقُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-creator, the All-knowing.
rows.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwal khallāqul `alīm

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ ٱلْمَثَانِى وَٱلْقُرْءَانَ ٱلْعَظِيمَ
rows.translation: Certainly We have given you [the surah of] the seven oft-repeated verses and the great Quran.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ātaynāka sab`an minal mathānī wal qur-ānal `aẓīm

rows.arabic: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Do not extend your glance toward what We have provided to certain groups of them, and do not grieve for them, and lower your wing to the faithful,
rows.transliteration: lā tamuddanna `aynayka ilā mā matta`nā bihi azwājan minhum walā taḥzan `alayhim wakhfiḍ janāḥaka lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَقُلْ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱلنَّذِيرُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
rows.translation: and say, ‘I am indeed a manifest warner [of punishment from God],’
rows.transliteration: waqul innī anan nadhīrul mubīn

rows.arabic: كَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَى ٱلْمُقْتَسِمِينَ
rows.translation: like that We sent down upon those who split into bands,
rows.transliteration: kamā anzalnā `alal-muqtasimīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ عِضِينَ
rows.translation: who represented the Quran as magic.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ja`alul qur-āna `iḍīn

rows.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْـَٔلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: By your Lord, We will question them all
rows.transliteration: fawarabbika lanas-alannahum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: concerning what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: `ammā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: فَٱصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: So proclaim what you have been commanded, and turn away from the polytheists.
rows.transliteration: faṣda` bimā tu-maru wa-a`riḍ `anil mushrikīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا كَفَيْنَـٰكَ ٱلْمُسْتَهْزِءِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed We will suffice you against the deriders
rows.transliteration: innā kafaynākal mustahzi-iyn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: —those who set up another deity besides Allah. Soon they will know!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yaj`alūna ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhar ۚ fasawfa ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly We know that you become upset because of what they say.
rows.transliteration: walaqad na`lamu annaka yaḍīqu ṣadruka bimā yaqūlūn

rows.arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: So celebrate the praise of your Lord and be among those who prostrate,
rows.transliteration: fasabbiḥ biḥamdi rabbika wakun minas sājidīn

rows.arabic: وَٱعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ ٱلْيَقِينُ
rows.translation: and worship your Lord until certainty comes to you.
rows.transliteration: wa`bud rabbaka ḥattā ya-tiyakal yaqīn
